Pushing the commit now, going to try with some sensible defaults in the `ServiceConfguration`. Please do not merge immediately. I'd consider this a WIP. IMO it is ugly having to declare bindAddress and advertisedAddress explicitly everywhere.

Right, all tls tests need to use localhost as `advertisedAddress` because of the certificate.
This does not seem to be an issue anymore.
FYI: I have not experienced this while working on https://github.com/yahoo/pulsar/pull/26

@radekg
Can you try: replacing `host` with `getAdvertisedAddress()` at [PulsarService](https://github.com/radekg/pulsar/blob/1db4d342b0e590c68804b5e3a3895226996d9036/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/PulsarService.java#L325)

As Pulsar has default SLAMonitoring-namespace which looks for broker-address registered at zk-loadbalancer node and it is registered with `getAdvertisedAddress()`  but right now it is getting `host` and therefore it is failing.

Change:

```
AdminResource.path("policies") + "/" + NamespaceService.getSLAMonitorNamespace(getAdvertisedAddress(), config)))
```

@rdhabalia that does the job. This is now passing the tests. Thank you! Can we review again?
I was also wondering if it isn't worth changing the `PulsarService.getHost()` to a little bit more descriptive `PulsarService.getBindAddress()`. What do you think?
I believe there is one more change required, here: https://github.com/yahoo/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/admin/PersistentTopics.java#L906
The failure seems to be one of those intermittent issues. It successfully ran here: https://travis-ci.org/radekg/pulsar/builds/162817512. I guess the build needs to be restarted?
Apparently, Travis has a limit of 4MB for job output and with this change that would be exceeded. I'll add the log4j conf file with default to off for now.

Seen it again on your PR :) 

Whenever  I get time, I'll try to reproduce in a local Docker container.

Committed a fix in bookkeeper branch at https://github.com/yahoo/bookkeeper/commit/89826351a698de7e0fac8d326596d840b8c2aa5e

Will close this issues when updating BK version here

yes.. as in few Test-cases, we don't set ackTimeout and do cumulative-ack and then verify ack-stat counter. now, as we are not instantiate ackTimer by default so, few of the test-cases were failing. I have fixed them now.
I can reproduce the test issue, by running it with `invocationCount=100` in a local Docker container. It fails after few iterations.
Apologies, fix coming, seems one can't simply `addConnector`. Running tests on the fork.

Typesafe config looks like a very nice written library. 

For broker config, I'd be ok to use it to populate the ServiceConfiguration. I'd like to maintain to have a single point to have to update when adding a new config variable. Currently, `ServiceConfiguration` is a pojo, and you just need to add a new variable with default value and example in `conf/broker.conf`. 

Alternatively, what about having `ServiceConfiguration` with only getters and adding a `ServiceConfigurationBuilder`?

Pushed the branch to remote but no pr, just so you can have a look. The most interesting points:
- `ServiceConfiguration` wraps and instance of Typesafe Config: https://github.com/radekg/pulsar/blob/7f58a69a2b51c1b3dfca7e03438e9cd1ec5a3afe/pulsar-broker-common/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/ServiceConfiguration.java
- pulsar-broker-common/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/ServiceConfigurationLoader.java is gone, not required
- config takes the following form: https://github.com/radekg/pulsar/blob/7f58a69a2b51c1b3dfca7e03438e9cd1ec5a3afe/pulsar-broker-common/src/test/resources/broker.conf
- config init: https://github.com/yahoo/pulsar/compare/master...radekg:immutable-config?expand=1#diff-b9da9463a373b0b19d516884fb70c189R33
- an example of setting up configuration for a test: https://github.com/yahoo/pulsar/compare/master...radekg:immutable-config?expand=1#diff-0a160247a547f35234439402e845f463R83 (it can be set up from the resource, this is what the final PR would be)
- overriding config from a base test class: https://github.com/yahoo/pulsar/compare/master...radekg:immutable-config?expand=1#diff-00841fa6f00fe82dab598394fc501144R107

This isn't a finished PR, tests need much more work. Also, the validation of `minValue` and `maxValue` isn't implemented but would be rather straightforward to implement.

To comply with what Typesafe Config needs, we would have to add `reference.conf` file to the `resources`.

Have a look, let me know what you think.
The next commit passes: https://travis-ci.org/radekg/pulsar/builds/163267361. Slightest blip on the main thread and some tests collapse.

For config file, would it be possible to maintain the same java properties format? That would keep it consistent with the other config files (client, bookkeeper, ..). It seems the only change is right now the `pulsar {....}` enclosing namespace.

I think that having to specify the config var name (either a string or a constant), makes a it bit more complicated to configure programmatically, since you have to lookup for the list of allowed variables, while with setters it's easy to discover all the options.
But other than the 2 notes above, it seems nice to combine multiple config sources
I think we should also import unit tests
imported unit-test cases after converting from junit to testng.

I would rather not break the config file compatibility unless is really necessary. Also, the other concern is that `bookkeeper.conf` and `zookeeper.conf` will still be in Java properties format and that cannot be easily changed.

@sboobna can you give a final pass?

Thank you for submitting this pull request, however I do not see a valid CLA on file for you. Before we can merge this request please visit https://yahoocla.herokuapp.com/ and agree to the terms. Thanks! :smile:

just a thought:
in this PR, we essentially have below change:
- instead of delivering all [pendingMessages](https://github.com/sschepens/pulsar/blob/0043cd61f0a1cc4412c313b34a089a7f2120e071/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/service/Consumer.java#L67), we try to redeliver [SimpleUnAckedMessageTracker. oldOpenSet](https://github.com/sschepens/pulsar/blob/0043cd61f0a1cc4412c313b34a089a7f2120e071/pulsar-client/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/client/impl/SimpleUnAckedMessageTracker.java#L50) messages which are actually timed-out by sending only those specific messageIds.
- As alternative can we just send head-messageId of [SimpleUnAckedMessageTracker. oldOpenSet](https://github.com/sschepens/pulsar/blob/0043cd61f0a1cc4412c313b34a089a7f2120e071/pulsar-client/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/client/impl/SimpleUnAckedMessageTracker.java#L50) to broker and broker will redeliver all [pending-messages](https://github.com/sschepens/pulsar/blob/0043cd61f0a1cc4412c313b34a089a7f2120e071/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/service/Consumer.java#L67) older than that message-id. It may help to avoid overhead of data-transfer and serialization/deserialization.

> instead of delivering all pendingMessages, we try to redeliver SimpleUnAckedMessageTracker. oldOpenSet messages which are actually timed-out by sending only those specific messageIds.

Yes

> As alternative can we just send head-messageId of SimpleUnAckedMessageTracker. oldOpenSet to broker and broker will redeliver all pending-messages older than that message-id. It may help to avoid overhead of data-transfer and serialization/deserialization.

I thought of this but, I don't really know if it's that easy.
Would it really work on a `Shared` subscription?
What if a message has been redelivered several times, everytime we receive a messageId that's newer we would redeliver that message as well. 

Yes, this implementation has a lot of network overhead but it is precise.

Another way to provide a more efficient behavior would be to move `UnAckedTracker` to the Broker, traditionally Brokers track when messages should be redelivered, but this would mean a whole lot of changes because `ackTimeout` should be passed when creating a subscription or be configurable per topic.
@rdhabalia This looks good to go. Can you rebase to resolve the conflict in `SimpleProducerConsumerTest.java` ?

I wouldn't characterize this as "message loss", since even if the particular message could be stuck, it would not be deleted until a consumer acknowledges it. So, reconnecting the consumer would unblock it.

I'm also not convinced that the condition can actually happen. Based on the code there would need to be these conditions : 
1. Use `receiveAsync()`
2. Disable consumer prefetch queue
3. We receive a message but we don't have a callback waiting for it

I'm not sure how if this can happen given that: 
1. If application used `receiveAsync()` then we would have a callback waiting
2. `reciveAsync()` request cannot be cancelled
3. When prefetch queue is 0, the consumer would have requested 1 single message from the broker, and timeout would not be allowed

To conclude, we could trigger the re-delivery of the ignored message, though it would be good to understand under which circumstances that condition can happen.

Change looks good to me, once you add some test to verify the new behavior we should be good to go.

There is one compilation failure in travis build : 

```
[ERROR] /home/travis/build/yahoo/pulsar/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/com/yahoo/pulsar/broker/service/Consumer.java:[433,24] error: incompatible types: bad return type in method reference
```

@sschepens About `BatchMessageIdImpl`,  after discussing with @rdhabalia and @sboobna, we concluded that: 
- Right now BatchMessageIdImpl are being added to the unacked message tracker (though there's no particular need for it
- With this PR, we would end up requesting the same batch multiple times

After #55 gets merged, only the "whole batch" MessageId will be inserted into the unacked message tracker, thus this PR will be good as it is now (except for some probable minor conflicts with the other PR)

Thank you for pointing this out. For some reason it seemed obvious that `SimpleDateFormat` should be thread-safe, but the javadoc it's pretty clear in that is not true.

I think we should just wrap all these instances with a `FastThreadLocal` class.
Oops, I haven't read @merlimat 's comment. I just sent a PR to replace the formatters with DateTimeFormatter.
@maskit actually `DateTimeFormatter` looks like a much better option (I didn't know about that class), since thread locals have some overhead

@sboobna Looks like a different test's failing now 😄 :

```
 SimpleProducerConsumerTest.testUnackBlockRedeliverMessages:1301 expected [20] but found [116]
```
@merlimat yeah I discussed with @rdhabalia about this, and looks like that was a bug in the blocking of consumer on the broker side. He has a fix for it in https://github.com/yahoo/pulsar/pull/63
Looks good, but wanted to check it with fresh eyes tomorrow
@merlimat I committed some tests, could you check them? They also raised a a few more tweaks to prevent using per message redelivery on subscriptions that are not shared.

~~@merlimat I don't really know why Travis keeps failing, It's complaining about the return type of method `ConcurrentOpenHashSet#remove`, it runs OK on my machine, could it be the jdk version?~~

Edit: Nevermind, I found the issue, could you give this a review now?
@rdhabalia Can you rebase this PR on latest master? There seems to be some minor conflict
I've rebased to current master and fixed some minor conflicts in #70
